intro: Trallesia matricarioides, commonly known as the common groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is an annual herb that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, with slender stems and alternate leaves that are usually heart-shaped. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a cluster at the ends of the stems, which bloom from spring to summer. It is often found in disturbed soils, such as along roadsides and in waste areas, and is known for its rapid growth and ability to colonize open spaces.
